sentences.sContent: A colloid is a suspension of particles within some substance.
sentences.sContent_eng: A colloid is a suspension of particles within some substance.
sentences.sCn: 胶质是某种物质的分子悬浮流体。

sentences.sContent: Among them agraffe is the most popular element, transparent colloid sole also is new use data.
sentences.sContent_eng: Among them agraffe is the most popular element, transparent colloid sole also is new use data.
sentences.sCn: 其中搭扣是最流行的元素，透明的胶质鞋底也是新使用的材料。

sentences.sContent: The follicles of the adenoma contain colloid, but there is greater variability in size than normal.
sentences.sContent_eng: The follicles of the adenoma contain colloid, but there is greater variability in size than normal.
sentences.sCn: 腺瘤滤泡内包含胶质，但滤泡大小不等。

trans.tranOther: a mixture having particles of one component, with diameters between 10–7 and 10–9 metres, suspended in a continuous phase of another component
